conclusion: Analyze the scene, trajectory of Car A, and physical interactions.
Car A is entering from the right side with a red arrow indicating a diagonal trajectory toward the center-left.
Objects on the table include a purple block, green block, yellow block, red block, blue block, pink-blue marble, and Car B.
Car A's trajectory is a straight line moving from the right edge toward the center-left.
Map out objects Car A might encounter: yellow block, pink-blue marble, red block, blue block.
Yellow block is directly in Car A's path and will be the first collision.
Car A's momentum will likely push the yellow block unless fixed.
Collision with yellow block may deflect Car A's path slightly.
After yellow block collision, Car A continues with reduced momentum and slightly adjusted trajectory.
Next object in path is the pink-blue marble.
Car A will likely strike the marble, causing it to roll.
Collision with marble will deflect Car A's path slightly.
After marble collision, Car A's trajectory is more downward-left.
Next object in path is the red block.
Car A will collide with the red block.
Red block will be pushed upon impact, Car A's momentum reduced.
Collision with red block may deflect Car A's path slightly.
After red block collision, Car A's speed is significantly reduced.
Next object in path is the blue block.
Car A will collide with the blue block.
Car A lacks energy to push blue block far and will likely stop.
Car A will stop near the blue block.
Purple and green blocks are too far from Car A's trajectory.
Car B is stationary and far from the path.
